The Paynter (Coming Soon).title: The Paynter (Coming Soon)
The Paynter (Coming Soon).desc:
** Launch date 14th September ** Register for stock notifications. 

Paynter Jacket Co. make limited edition jackets four times a year that are made to order, so there's no waste from over production. Their jackets are classic pieces that will stand the test of time and get better with age. The Field Jacket is Paynter's first make-your-own jacket pattern in collaboration with Merchant & Mills.

All paper patterns will include two woven labels, one is to be positioned inside the jacket near the hip and the other is a smaller label for the back neck. The larger label has been designed by @hello.ludio. Lucie’s design features the sun and the moon to represent time and getting lost in the practice of making. These labels are only available in the paper pattern, not PDF, and won’t be sold elsewhere.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

Skill level; Advanced.

Fabric suggestions - We recommend light to medium weight wovens up to 8oz, cotton twills, denim, wool and dry oilskin. There are 9 layers to sew through during the pocket construction, so check the fabric you choose can be accommodated by your sewing machine.
notions: matching thread (3x 100m reels) plus more for overlocking
10cm/4yd lightweight cotton for pocket flap tabs, if using heavy fabric
fabric_reqs: light to medium weight wovens up to 8oz

Carrier Bag PDF.title: Carrier Bag PDF
Carrier Bag PDF.desc: Based on a classic everyday design, the carrier bag has feature french seams and an added lining. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

The Scout.title: The Scout
The Scout.desc: The Scout was inspired by 1920's women's scouting uniforms. Make as a neat shirt or dress with optional tie. The dress has in-seam pockets. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Niven.title: The Niven
The Niven.desc: A classic shirt-dress or shirt featuring a bib, grandad collar and cuffed sleeves. Dress has in-seam pockets. Niven has been designed to be an oversized fit. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Honey.title: The Honey
The Honey.desc: Channelling the free spirits of the 1970's, The Honey is a maxi sundress made for lazy days. Featuring a neat mitred bodice and a gently elasticated back. Choose bold patterns, little prints or plains for distinctively different looks. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Pegs.title: The Pegs
The Pegs.desc: A pair of 'Peg' trousers featuring a fly front, angled pockets and turn-ups. Front legs can be half lined for woollens. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Etta.title: The Etta
The Etta.desc: Etta is a simple wrap dress with a lined bodice and inseam pockets. Choose between short or three quarter length sleeves or make it sleeveless. The dress has an inner tie so you can choose how loose you want your wrap to be, but it is designed to not be fitted at the waist. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Lilian PDF UK XS - XXL.title: The Lilian PDF UK XS - XXL
The Lilian PDF UK XS - XXL.desc: A simple slip dress to wear under dresses that are a little sheer. It can also be a nightdress. We designed this slip dress as lots of our Indian handlooms are semi sheer so this gives you an extra bit of coverage. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Celeste.title: The Celeste
The Celeste.desc: A feminine blouse with back buttons and gentle gathers into a waistband. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Mathilde PDF.title: The Mathilde PDF
The Mathilde PDF.desc: A simple set of instructions to make a skirt with a deep elasticated waistband. Make with patch, inseam or no pockets. A zero to minimal waste pattern that can make the most of fabrics in your stash. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Cawley.title: The Cawley
The Cawley.desc: A twist on an artist's smock designed by Cawley Studio. Featuring front welt and in-seam pockets with an optional belt. Perfect in utility cloth. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern. Suitable fabrics include medium dress weight wovens, sanded twill, linen, 6-9oz denim, corduroy, tencel, and tencel/linen.

The Trapeze.title: The Trapeze
The Trapeze.desc: A flared dress, just below the knee, with small neat shoulder and shallow rounded neckline. With the option of a button through back or a simple slip over the head. The trapeze is so easy to make and so easy to wear. Make it for the winter in Harris tweed teamed with a chunky brogue, in a bold block print or a washed linen for the summer. It is endlessly versatile. You have the option of making this 3/4 sleeved, sleeveless and short sleeved, all with a button back opening. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
notions: Buttons - 10 x 20 - 23mm (For the top you will need 6 buttons)

The Ludlow.title: The Ludlow
The Ludlow.desc: A pullover unisex smock with integrated pockets. Lengthen the pattern where indicated for men's sizing. This pattern is designed for mid-weight utility fabrics like denim and canvas, the heavier the fabric the more structured your silhouette will be. Lighter weight fabrics will result in a more relaxed, softer silhouette. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern. Skill level; Intermediate. Suitable fabrics - 8-12oz cotton canvas and twill, dry oilskin and oilskin, 8-14oz denim and corduroy. A heavier weight cloth will result in a more structured jacket. The paper is PEFC/01-31-126 certified.

The Audrey PDF.title: The Audrey PDF
The Audrey PDF.desc: Not a scarf but more than a hood! Audrey is a warm layer over a coat or a pop of colour over a dress. Make it with contrast or self lining. Seam allowance is 1cm, unless stated otherwise.
fabric_reqs: quilted jacquard (use a lightweight lining if using jacquard)

Sturdy Tote PDF.title: Sturdy Tote PDF
Sturdy Tote PDF.desc: A sturdy, lined tote bag with inner pockets and turned through handles. This bag is designed to be made in thick cloth so it keeps its shape well. Using a medium weight lining will also aid this shape. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

Betty Apron PDF.title: Betty Apron PDF
Betty Apron PDF.desc: A slip over the head apron with a crossover back, ideal in a soft tumbled linen. This PDF pattern is made up of 14 A4 pages.

Francli Pocket Bag PDF.title: Francli Pocket Bag PDF
Francli Pocket Bag PDF.desc: A practical pocket bag, with an inner pocket, magnetic clasp fastening and sliding knot strap. This bag will hold a phone 15cm/6" x 8cm/3 1/4". You can increase the height of the bag if needed by cutting through the lengthen line (see instructions). All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

The Grove Creations PDF.title: The Grove Creations PDF
The Grove Creations PDF.desc:
The Grove Creations PDF bundle is a set of 4 PDF patterns to make for the home. This project came about when we were renovating the Merchant & Mills house in Rye (The Grove) and wanted to use our fabrics but within a home setting. Your PDF includes:

Duvet Set

Instructions for making two duvet sets, one with concealed buttons and one with ties. Matching pillow slips, again either with buttons or ties. Included are options for single, double, king and super king. We recommend using our extra wide linen as this is 280cm wide, but we have included a formula if you are using narrower fabric.

Pillowcase

Instructions for making a simple pillowcase with a deep envelope. Ideal as scatter cushions for the bed or sofa.

Quilt & Sofa/Bed Topper

Instructions for making a quilt or a topper for a bed or sofa. We designed this quilt as an ideal way to showcase our laundered linens, it’s very fun picking the combinations! The toppers are ideal for covering a sofa that your dog might want to keep jumping on, or toppers for wooden benches like we have in the pictures. The topper is made using self made fabric ties, and the quilt is made with lots of ties of linen thread. But these techniques can be interchangeable. We recommend using our Cloudwool wadding as it is the most sustainable wadding option we have found, recycled polyester is also an option if you want a light but more lofty quilt (we do not sell this). We also have this wool blend wadding which is much lighter weight but ideal if you have two thick fabrics to sandwich between. It is up to you how many layers of wadding to use.

Relaxed Blind

Instructions for making a simple draped roman blind. This type of blind is a more modern take on a traditional roman blind and very much suits a laundered linen for an informal look.

All seam allowances are 1cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

Skill level; beginner - intermediate.

The Margo.title: The Margo
The Margo.desc: A hard working pinafore dress, featuring classic detailing and topstitching. Choose to make it with dungaree clips or sewn in straps. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern. Suitable fabrics: medium weight woven cloth, 8-12oz denim, cotton canvas, cotton drill, corduroy, and yarn dyed medium weight linen.
notions: 6 x hammer on-buttons or sew on buttons.
0.45M lining for pocket and waist facing.

The Sanda.title: The Sanda
The Sanda.desc:
An oversized coat or jacket with a rolled collar and turn back cuffs. Coat has inseam pockets and jacket has patch pockets. Choose to make either lined or unlined.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

Skill level; intermediate.

Suitable fabrics - Dry oilskin, oilskin, linen, 7-12oz denim, wool, corduroy, cotton twill or canvas. A heavier weight cloth will result in a more structured coat. 

For linings we'd suggest our barrier lining if using an oilskin, otherwise - cotton voile, lightweight linen, cotton poplin, lightweight wool and slip linings.

**Please note we have now changed pattern printers. Our patterns are now printed within Europe, the pattern paper is 70gsm white (FSC® certified) and is made only 180km away from the printers. Our instructions now come in booklet format rather than A3 sheets. The paper is PEFC/01-31-126 certified.

The Clover.title: The Clover
The Clover.desc: A simple t-shaped dress or top with a gathered drawstring neckline that can be adjusted to sit at your desired height. Make it sleeveless or with sleeves, structured and architectural in poplin or soft and relaxed in linen. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Harlene.title: The Harlene
The Harlene.desc: A traditional pair of easy fitting dungarees. A hard-working wardrobe staple featuring classic detailing and optional top stitching. These dungarees are meant to be oversized. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Denham.title: The Denham
The Denham.desc: Inspired by a vintage Austrian hiking jacket. This neat mid-season piece is perfect for all weathers. A double breasted jacket that can be lined or unlined. It features two flap pockets and a button tab to close the collar. Denham is more closely fitting than a lot of our other patterns, do carefully check the finished measurements table, and if in doubt size up. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.
notions: 0.4M / 1/2YD of lining for the pocket bags

Francli Day Pack.title: Francli Day Pack
Francli Day Pack.desc: A practical day pack designed by Francli Craftwear. Play with hardy fabrics and unique M&M hardware to create a bespoke pack for everyday life and adventures further afield. With water bottle pockets and internal laptop pocket. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

Docker's Beanie PDF.title: Docker's Beanie PDF
Docker's Beanie PDF.desc: A classic six pannelled beanie, featuring a turned up band and elasticated back. Make it lined or unlined. Seam allowance is 1cm, unless stated otherwise.

The Omilie.title: The Omilie
The Omilie.desc: Omilie is a smock top or dress featuring patch pockets and in-seam pockets (dress only) with a choice of two sleeve lengths. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Quinn.title: The Quinn
The Quinn.desc: A pair of 'sailor' inspired wide leg trousers, featuring back welt pockets and front pockets with button openings. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern. Skill level; Intermediate. Suitable fabrics - medium weight woven fabric such as cotton twill, denim, corduroy, light to medium weight woollens and linen. Please note we have now changed pattern printers. Our patterns are now printed within Europe, the pattern paper is 70gsm white (FSC® certified) and is made only 180km away from the printers. Our instructions now come in booklet format rather than A3 sheets. The paper is PEFC/01-31-126 certified.

The Elling.title: The Elling
The Elling.desc: An everyday men's elasticated trouser with front slanted pockets and back patch pockets. Make them with or without a zip. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Arbor.title: The Arbor
The Arbor.desc: A jacket or shirt. Workwear inspired; make Arbor yours in anything from canvas or wool to a lightweight linen. This shirt has a boxy style fit, please check the finished measurements to make sure you are happy with the final fit. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Billy.title: The Billy
The Billy.desc: A hardworking gilet. Make yours lined or unlined, with facings on the inside or outside. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.

The Miller.title: The Miller
The Miller.desc: A softly structured waistcoat with a boxy fit, two welt pockets and a simple stitched belt at the back. Layer up in the winter or wear on its own in the summer in a tumbled linen. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
notions: buckle slider - 2.5CM / 1" or two extra buttons (optional)
fabric_reqs: lightweight woven lining such as calico

The Ellsworth.title: The Ellsworth
The Ellsworth.desc:
An oversized, boxy shirt with a dropped back hem and half placket. Swingy and absurdly comfortable.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

Skill level - intermediate.

Fabric suggestions - 3-6oz linen, cotton poplin, cotton lawn, cotton double gauze, Indian handlooms, cotton chambray, Tencel, hemp/cotton blends. Do not choose anything too heavy, as the back is lower than the front it will pull down making it uncomfortable at the neck!

The Barka Dog Coat PDF.title: The Barka Dog Coat PDF
The Barka Dog Coat PDF.desc: A simple dog coat for your furry friend. Make it bagged out with lining or lined with bound edges. 10% of sales for this pattern will be going to Dogs Trust UK. Seam allowance is 1cm, unless stated otherwise. This PDF pattern is made up of 1 A0 page and 7 A4 pages. Note: For both views, and how to measure your dog, please look at the line drawings in our gallery.

The Winnie.title: The Winnie
The Winnie.desc: A traditional pair of pyjamas with either long or short sleeves and long, short or short-short bottoms. The top and short-short bottoms can be piped (optional). All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

The Shepherd.title: The Shepherd
The Shepherd.desc: A pleated A-line skirt with slanted pockets, side button fastenings and pleats for fullness. Soft and floaty in linen, or smart and hardy in cotton twill. Can be made lined or unlined. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Sidney PDF UK 6 - 18.title: The Sidney PDF UK 6 - 18
The Sidney PDF UK 6 - 18.desc: Sidney is a boxy sweatshirt with a loose crew neck and finger skimming sleeves. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

The September.title: The September
The September.desc: Overcoat meets duster. An oversized coat for striding through town and country with purpose. Choose to make either lined or unlined. The September works for a variety of seasons, in oilskin or wool it can be a proper winter coat, or in linen it feels like a casual throw on. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Edie PDF UK 6 - 18.title: The Edie PDF UK 6 - 18
The Edie PDF UK 6 - 18.desc:
The balloon sleeves of this simple top and dress are the only detail that it requires to stand out. Less is more. The full sleeves are gathered with a tie which is threaded through a buttonhole, alternatively you can omit this buttonhole and insert elastic instead.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

This PDF pattern is made up of 5 A0 pages and 38 A4 pages.

Fabric suggestions - lighter weight woven fabrics, linen and linen blends, poplin, hemp and hemp blends, cotton chambray, Indian handweaves and block prints, tencel and tencel blends. The more structured the fabric the more sculptural your top will look.

The Sunday.title: The Sunday
The Sunday.desc: Easy like Sunday morning, wrap up and settle in. A traditional unisex dressing gown with inner tie, patch pockets and a shawl collar.

The Mary White.title: The Mary White
The Mary White.desc: A loose fitting dress or top with front and back pleats, side in-seam pockets (dress only), breast pocket and a sailor collar. Perfect attire for any board walk. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Eve Trousers.title: The Eve Trousers
The Eve Trousers.desc: The Eve Trouser is cropped, with a slightly tapered leg and optional turn ups. It's an easy garment to make, fitting neatly at the waist and over the hips with a simple side zip and two back pockets. Choose to make pleats or darts into the waist seam. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Florence.title: The Florence
The Florence.desc: The Florence is a sweet swingy top and dress with a button back detail and soft high low gathers. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Thelma PDF UK 6 - 18.title: The Thelma PDF UK 6 - 18
The Thelma PDF UK 6 - 18.desc: A traditional workwear boilersuit with a gentler feminine fit. Thelma is a wardrobe masterpiece, loose enough to fit all shapes and can be interpreted in many different types of cloths, so make it your own. Thelma will take time to put together, but make it well and wear it absolutely everywhere. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
fabric_reqs: yard dyed linens with some stability

The Hattie & Ellis PDF UK 8 - 18.title: The Hattie & Ellis PDF UK 8 - 18
The Hattie & Ellis PDF UK 8 - 18.desc: A perfect combination for any mood, if Ellis is a gentle woman then Hattie is a blithe bachelorette. Both feature four delicate neck darts, Ellis, who gets some more feminine shaping from bust darts, is waisted, with set in sleeves and inseam side pockets. Hattie has a lined bodice, dropped waist and bold patch pockets. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
fabric_reqs: light to medium weight woven cottons

The Ottoline PDF.title: The Ottoline PDF
The Ottoline PDF.desc: The Ottoline is a boxy workwear jacket with cuff and side seam splits and inside pocket. Although a lovely design detail the vents are a little tricky, so we have included instructions to simplify Ottoline by excluding the side seams and sleeve vents if you like. We have found that a heavy duty thread rather than a topstitch thread gives a more authentic look to the topstitching and is easier to use. You may find you get a better stitch using a matching 'sew all' thread in the bobbin. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated. This PDF pattern is made up of 2 A0 pages and 33 A4 pages. We recommend pre washing your denim before sewing. When you have made your jacket we would recommend washing it inside out.
notions: Buttons - 5 x approx 22mm (7 if you are doing buttons at the cuff)

The Heroine PDF.title: The Heroine PDF
The Heroine PDF.desc: The Heroine jeans are fitted to the waist with a straight, generous leg and a healthy turn up. Perfectly matched with a Camber Tee. This is a pattern that we would advise making a toile first, firstly to adjust the fit if needed but secondly to familiarise with the pattern instructions. We have not used a traditional run and fell jeans seam, we have chosen instead to topstitch the seam, which is easier to achieve on a domestic machine. We have found that a heavy duty thread rather than a topstitch thread gives a more authentic look to the topstitching and is easier to use. You may find that you get a better stitch using a matching standard 'sew all' thread in the bobbin. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated. Fabric suggestions include 8 - 12.5oz non-stretch denim (up to 14oz with a heavy-duty machine). We recommend pre washing your denim before sewing. Putting a large piece of medium-heavy weight denim into the washing machine can sometimes lead to white creases in the denim, this is because it is a stiff fabric so it doesn’t have room to move around. For the first wash, use a delicate 30 degree cycle with a low spin. When you have made the jeans, we would recommend washing them inside out.
notions: Plain cotton fabric for pocket bags

The Whittaker PDF.title: The Whittaker PDF
The Whittaker PDF.desc: A classic pinafore for work and play. With a buttoned side fastening, side and back pockets. Make it long with a back split or short just below the knee. Accentuate the detailing with contrast top stitching or keep it simple with matching thread.

The Clementine PDF.title: The Clementine PDF
The Clementine PDF.desc: Slim fitting jeans skirt with a back split and shaped waist band. This is a pattern that we would advise making a toile first, firstly to adjust the fit if needed but secondly to familiarise with the pattern instructions. We have not used a traditional run and fell jeans seam, we have chosen instead to topstitch the seam, which is easier to achieve on a domestic machine. We have found that a heavy duty thread rather than a topstitch thread gives a more authentic look to the topstitching and is easier to use. You may find that you get a better stitch using a matching standard 'sew all' thread in the bobbin. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated. This PDF pattern is made up of 2 A0 pages and 33 A4 pages.
notions: Plain cotton fabric for pocket bags
fabric_reqs: up to 14oz denim with a heavy duty sewing machine

The Francine PDF.title: The Francine PDF
The Francine PDF.desc: Inspired by the fisherman of Brittany this simple top or dress could become a wardrobe staple. Slim fitted top or A line dress with an inside breast pocket and pockets in the side seams. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The TN31 Parka.title: The TN31 Parka
The TN31 Parka.desc: TN31 is a relaxed and versatile interpretation of the classic fishtail parka. Lined or unlined it can work for all seasons. It has side pockets, front welt pockets, a back vent and optional drawstring waist. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Foreman.title: The Foreman
The Foreman.desc: Inspired by traditional workwear of the early fifties, the practical and hardwearing Foreman is an unlined utilitarian jacket made to take charge. Features a boxy cut, 2 piece sleeves, a neat square collar, 2 hip pockets and one breast pocket. Can be optionally top-stitched in contrasting thread.

The Tee Shirt.title: The Tee Shirt
The Tee Shirt.desc: The T shirt is probably the world's most popular garment, presented here as a smart, contemporary evolution of a wardrobe staple. Our Tee Shirt is a smart combination of a woven fabric with a stretch rib neck, a breast pocket and optional rolled up sleeves. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
notions: ribbing - 0.1m/4yd or 1x Merchant & Mills ribbing strip

The All State PDF.title: The All State PDF
The All State PDF.desc: Swagger like a rebel to the ball park in this short sleeve boxy shirt, best worn casual in cotton or linen. Inspired by the American style of the fifties. Features a one piece collar, patch pocket, back yoke, short sleeves and short side splits. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Factory.title: The Factory
The Factory.desc:
Inspired by working women, with a dash of the Twenties. The Factory Dress slips over the head, features pockets and ready-rolled up sleeves. The Factory dress is 'easy fit' so use the bust measurement only for sizing.

We have now included a seperate pattern to make the Factory as a top. 

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

Skill level - beginner.

Fabric suggestions - linen, linen blends, tencel, cotton chambray, very fine wool or corduroy.

*Please note we have now changed pattern printers. Our patterns are now printed within Europe, the pattern paper is 70gsm white (FSC® certified) and is made only 180km away from the printers. Our instructions now come in booklet format rather than A3 sheets. The paper is PEFC/01-31-126 certified.
notions: Inner pockets can be made in self or lining
The Factory.description: Inspired by working women, with a dash of the Twenties. The Factory Dress slips over the head, features pockets and ready-rolled up sleeves. The Factory dress is 'easy fit' so use the bust measurement only for sizing. We have now included a separate pattern to make the Factory as a top. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated. Skill level - beginner. Fabric suggestions - linen, linen blends, tencel, cotton chambray, very fine wool or corduroy. Our patterns are now printed within Europe, the pattern paper is 70gsm white (FSC® certified) and is made only 180km away from the printers. Our instructions now come in booklet format rather than A3 sheets. The paper is PEFC/01-31-126 certified.

The Camber Set.title: The Camber Set
The Camber Set.desc:
A simple dress with tapered A-line silhouette and short fitted sleeves for an easy-wear classic. Features 2 versions – Dress or T-shirt.

We have a tutorial video to accompany this pattern - click here to view. Or you can view the video on our IGTV page on Instagram.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The 101 Trouser.title: The 101 Trouser
The 101 Trouser.desc: Gentle drawstring trouser with side pockets and a false fly, cut to sit on the waist. Features 3 versions – cropped & tapered trouser, wide straight trouser or shorts. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
notions: Eyelets - x 2 (optional eyelet or buttonhole for drawstring)

The Box Box PDF.title: The Box Box PDF
The Box Box PDF.desc: Dress it up or down, this boxy top or dress is going to be an essential wardrobe addition. The front pleat detail is enough to make this design stand out. The simple rouleaux loop-back neck closure reflects the simplicity of the silhouette. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
fabric_reqs: light to medium weight woven cottons

The Dress Shirt.title: The Dress Shirt
The Dress Shirt.desc: The Dress Shirt is a lightweight, versatile dress inspired by Grandpa’s shirt. It is a relaxed, classic cut to be worn loose and is absurdly comfortable. Includes a rolled up sleeve or a short sleeve. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Fielder.title: The Fielder
The Fielder.desc: The Fielder (top or dress) is based on a traditional sweatshirt with ribbed neck, sleeves and hem (tops only). It features three quarter length raglan sleeves and inseam side pockets (dress only). Imagined in our various laundered linens with a matching cotton rib. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.
notions: Pocket bags can be cut in self or lining fabric

The Top 64 PDF.title: The Top 64 PDF
The Top 64 PDF.desc: Inspired by the classic fisherman's top, this feminine version is more than a jumper but less than a jacket. All decorative top stitching is optional. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Landgate PDF.title: The Landgate PDF
The Landgate PDF.desc: The hooded Landgate is chic yet workaday and features a drawstring waist and side and front pocket options. Our first pattern for both men and women. All decorative top stitching is optional. For the men's pattern you lengthen the pattern where indicated. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated. This PDF pattern is made up of 3 A0 pages and 45 A4 pages.
notions: Metal eyelets - approx 7mm internal diameter x 2 (optional)
Fusible interfacing for pockets and buttonholes/eyelets (not for oilskin)

The Swing Top PDF.title: The Swing Top PDF
The Swing Top PDF.desc: The Swing Top is a loose fitting top with dropped shoulders, a Henley neck and button placket. It also features a shirt tail front and cropped back, gathered into the back yoke. We have paired it with 101 trousers in the picture, but it also pairs beautifully with our Eve trousers or Heroine jeans because of the high waist. This is a style that used to be available in our RTW collection, and we've made it a pattern as so many of you wanted to make your own! All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Strand PDF.title: The Strand PDF
The Strand PDF.desc: The Strand is a simple unlined coat for cutting a dash in the city. The side seams have been brought to the front and feature a side pocket. The waist seam has an in-seam pocket. The sleeves are set in and sport elbow darts and the front fastening is created by 5 x 1.8cm inseam hooks and eyes. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Rugby PDF.title: The Rugby PDF
The Rugby PDF.desc: Kick off your day with our feminine semi-fitted take on the traditional rugby shirt. Make a try for contrast collar, cuffs and placket or stand firm in a solid colour throughout. This PDF pattern is made up of 2 A0 pages and 33 A4 pages. Fabric suggestions - suitable for linen or light wools, light to medium weight woven cottons such as drill or sanded canvas.
fabric_reqs: light to medium weight woven cottons

The Skipper PDF.title: The Skipper PDF
The Skipper PDF.desc:
Little girl pattern for ages 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 years. Inspired by the classic sailor bib, we pay homage to the ancient port of Rye (our hometown).

Irresistibly redolant of carefree summer days and never growing up, the skipper is born to play. Featuring relaxed styling for easy dressing in rough seas, the Skipper has dropped shoulders and casual rolled cuffs whilst the neckline has an internal popper at the front V insert.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

Skill level - intermediate.

This PDF pattern is made up of 1 A0 page and 19 A4 pages.

Fabric suggestions - we recommend medium to lightweight woven fabrics such as denim, cotton chambray, laundered linen or lightweight wool.

The Trapezette PDF.title: The Trapezette PDF
The Trapezette PDF.desc: Little girl pattern for ages 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 years. A charmingly simple interpretation of our Trapeze dress with a huge amount of swish factor. The Trapezette is simple to make with a single button back neck opening and rouleau loop and fully faced armholes and neck for small people comfort. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Workaday PDF.title: The Workaday PDF
The Workaday PDF.desc: A traditional unisex apron for industrious demands. Choose oilskin or denim for a classic workwear feel, or a soft tumbled linen for wearing everyday around the house. The workaday has 3 pockets, and a waist and neck tie that can be lengthened or shortened as needed. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Victor PDF.title: The Victor PDF
The Victor PDF.desc:
Our Oilskin Competition winner by Lucy Dunham. A perfectly functioning apron for makers of all disciplines, adjustable for all shapes and sizes and featuring a cross back for comfort, top pocket for smalls and large divided waist pocket with scissor holder.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

Skill level - advanced beginner.

This PDF pattern is made up of 1 A0 page and 24 A4 pages.

Fabric suggestions - Oilskin, Dry Oilskin, Denim (8oz to 14oz), Mid-Heavy Weight Cotton Canvas or Drill.

The Factotum.title: The Factotum
The Factotum.desc: A neat cross body bag, small but copious. Factotum has been designed to hold all your daily essentials. Fully lined, with two front pockets and a zipped closure. You can use leather or webbing for your strap. All seam allowances are 1cm unless otherwise stated.

The Jack Tar.title: The Jack Tar
The Jack Tar.desc: This copious bucket bag has space for an almost infinite amount of stuff. Make it in traditional British oilskin, sturdy canvas, cotton drill or denim. The most useful of bags. Fully lined with 3 divided internal pockets, for external pockets you will need an additional 30cm of self fabric. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

Orton Bag PDF.title: Orton Bag PDF
Orton Bag PDF.desc:
A marvellous oversized tote bag with variations to make it in 'self' so same fabric body as handles, with webbing handles or leather handles. There are separate files, depending on whether you want to make the bag lined or unlined.

We now have a video you can watch for extra help! Click here. Or you can view the video on our IGTV page on Instagram.

All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The Field Belt PDF.title: The Field Belt PDF
The Field Belt PDF.desc: The Field Belt is designed to carry all of your travel essentials neatly around the waist leaving your hands free for chopping logs or pointing at historical buildings. The bag is fully lined. All seam allowances are 1cm unless stated otherwise and are included in the pattern.
notions: 12.5MM/1/2" leather strap x 38.5CM (we recommend split cowhide)
25MM/1" leather strap x minimum 1.1M (we recommend split cowhide)

The Costermonger.title: The Costermonger
The Costermonger.desc: The Costermonger is the essential market tote designed as a backpack. Fill it up with wholesome goodies, leaving your hands free to tickle your dog. This is a simple satisfying sew that uses little fabric so ideal for using up some of your stash or making as a present. The instructions show you how to make it with leather or webbing. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

RTR Rucksack PDF.title: RTR Rucksack PDF
RTR Rucksack PDF.desc: Claim your right to roam with this fine rucksack on your back. Make it in traditional British oilskin or a sturdy canvas. Fully lined with 3 divided internal pockets. The pattern includes a cross-body bag as an alternative. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.

The One and a Half Bag PDF.title: The One and a Half Bag PDF
The One and a Half Bag PDF.desc: A marvellous oversized bag with webbing handles that continue down to the bottom seam and a second horizontal handle position, with the potential to tuck away the larger bag. Seam allowance is 1.5cm and is included in the pattern.

The Tailor's Tool Roll PDF.title: The Tailor's Tool Roll PDF
The Tailor's Tool Roll PDF.desc: A versatile tool roll holder with 15 assorted pockets. It can be adapted to be worn around the waist. You can use either leather or webbing on the inside of the roll, if you are using leather, we'd recommend something fairly lightweight like a goat's leather. This PDF pattern is made up of 1 A0 page and 23 A4 pages.
notions: 25CM x 2M British Webbing or cotton tape

The Stocking PDF.title: The Stocking PDF
The Stocking PDF.desc: A stylish Christmas stocking to decorate any mantelpiece and utilise leftover fabric. 100% of sales for this pattern will be going to Unicef. Seam allowance is 1.5cm, unless stated otherwise.

Factory Top Addition PDF.title: Factory Top Addition PDF
Factory Top Addition PDF.desc: This is a PDF pattern that will give you the relevant pattern pieces to make the Factory Dress into a Top, with a middle vent. Please note if you are buying a current version of the Factory Dress pattern the addition is now included in the pattern. All seam allowances are 1.5cm unless otherwise stated.
